summary: This document is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York daily lieutenant's log for July 30, 2019, detailing routine operations and inmate movements across three shifts. It records Jeffrey Epstein as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion and notes his transfer from a housing unit. The log ends with Epstein still in custody, the day before his death.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, listed on psychological observation with an inmate companion during the morning and day watch. He was released from HA (Housing Unit A) to ZA (Special Housing Unit) at 12:21 PM.

events.title: Epstein on Psychological Observation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion during the morning and day watch shifts.

events.title: Epstein Transferred to Special Housing
events.description: At 12:21 PM, inmate Epstein (#76318-054) was released from HA (Housing Unit A) to ZA (Special Housing Unit).

events.title: Routine MCC Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: The log details standard prison operations including multiple inmate counts, body alarm tests, court movements for several inmates, hospital transports, new commitments, and a facility lockdown for count.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation with an inmate companion on July 30, 2019, at the MCC in New York.
Epstein was transferred from Housing Unit A (HA) to the Special Housing Unit (ZA) at 12:21 PM on that date.
The log shows routine prison operations were ongoing, including multiple inmate counts and security checks.
Several other inmates were documented as being in court, at hospitals, or being released/committed.
This log captures Epstein's status and location within the MCC the day before his death on July 31, 2019.
